title: 02 Diffie Hellman Key Exchange
description: # Challenge 2: Simple RSA Encryption **Challenge Text:** ``` n = 3233, e = 17, Encrypted message: [2201, 2332, 1452] ``` **Instructions:** 1. Factorize the value of \( n \) into two prime numbers, \( p \) and \( q \). 2. Compute the private key \( d \) using the Extended Euclidean Algorithm. 3. Decrypt the message using the computed private key. ### Answer:
payloads: 1. Factorize the value of \( n \) into two prime numbers, \( p \) and \( q \).
2. Compute the private key \( d \) using the Extended Euclidean Algorithm.
3. Decrypt the message using the computed private key.
Code snippet in Python to perform the entire decryption:
g, x, y = egcd(b % a, a)
